node.title: China Looking to Take Control of Taiwan Without Military Conflict, Defense Ministry Says
node.alt: According to the Taiwan Defense Ministry, China's strategy includes cyber-warfare, propaganda and a campaign to isolate Taiwan internationally. The Taiwan military honor guard performs during National Day celebrations in front of the Presidential Building in Taipei, Taiwan, on October 10.
node.description: The Taiwan Defense Ministry said China is trying to instill fear into the Taiwanese people using cyber-warfare and propaganda.
node.content:
["China has continued to apply pressure to allegedly assume dominance over Taiwan.", "Taiwan strongly considers itself a sovereign state nation, but China still harbors claims over the island nation, viewing the country as a breakaway province.", "Previously, Chinese state media have sought to quiet theorizing in order to not to feed public concern over the risk of war.", "China has been stepping up tactical threats in recent weeks by sending planes close to the island nation and demonstrating military exercises.", "Taiwan's Defense Ministry said in a biennial report Tuesday, that the demonstrations reflect Beijing's effort to degrade Taiwan's air force through wear and tear and heavy requirements on its personnel.", "Now, China seems to be taking a psychological root by trying to instill fear into the Taiwanese people.", "The biennial report also said the strategy includes cyber-warfare, propaganda and a campaign to isolate Taiwan internationally in order to accept China's terms without participating in a shooting war.", "China is likely trying to avoid actual military engagement to avoid conflict with the U.S.", "U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinked said earlier this month that the U.S. commitment to the island is \"rock solid.\"", "For more reporting from the Associated Press, see below:", "", "
According to the Taiwan Defense Ministry, China's strategy includes cyber-warfare, propaganda and a campaign to isolate Taiwan internationally. The Taiwan military honor guard performs during National Day celebrations in front of the Presidential Building in Taipei, Taiwan, on October 10.
", "During China's National Day weekend in early October, China dispatched 149 military aircraft southwest of Taiwan in strike group formations, causing Taiwan to scramble aircraft and activate its air defense missile systems.", "China and Taiwan separated during a civil war in 1949. While the U.S. cut formal diplomatic relations with Taipei in 1979 in order to recognize Beijing, Washington is committed by law to ensure the island can defend itself and to treat all threats toward it as matters of grave concern.", "Asked in a recent CNN town hall whether the U.S. would come to Taiwan's defense if attacked, U.S. President Joe Biden said, \"Yes, we have a commitment to do that.\" U.S. officials immediately moved to clarify that there had been no change in the U.S. posture toward Taiwan.", "While Taiwan relies on the U.S. for much of its military hardware, President Tsai Ing-wen has been pushing for a revitalization of its domestic defense industry, including the production of conventionally powered submarines."]
